title: Blockbuster semifinal at the French Open: Will Swiatek or Sabalenka win?
description: On Thursday, No. 1 Sabalenka will play defending French Open champ Swiatek. We break it down.
author: Simon Cambers

title: To serve or to receive? The ultimate decision for any pro tennis player
description: The coin toss winner in a tennis match gets the choice: to receive or serve first. And the pro players are surprisingly divided on it.
author: Simon Cambers

title: Unlock the Perfect Slice Serve - Essential Tennis Podcast #415
description: The wide slice serve is a CRITICAL tool to have in your tool box. It pulls opponents out of position, opens the court up for you to hit into, exposes their usually weaker backhand side, and forces them to run twice as far for the next shot - if they even get it at all. Letâ€™s take a deep dive into how YOU can develop this powerful weapon, step by step in this special episode of the Essential Tennis Podcast.
author: Essential Tennis LLC

title: 3 Djokovic Secrets To Winning More Matches - Essential Tennis Podcast #414
description: In this special episode of the Essential Tennis Podcast, you're going to learn the top 3 tactical secrets of Novak Djokovic that you can apply in your very next match. Use these tools to gain precision, consistency, and offense to make your opponents more uncomfortable, win more points, and win more matches.
author: Essential Tennis LLC

title: 'Magnificent' Alcaraz through to semi-final meeting with Musetti
description: Defending champion Carlos Alcaraz produces a dominant display to sweep past Tommy Paul in straight sets and reach the French Open semi-finals, where he will meet Lorenzo Musetti.

title: From 'disgraceful' low to 'best day of life' - how Vegas trip inspired Bublik
description: Alexander Bublik hated tennis. Then, a 'Hangover'-style trip to Las Vegas inspired him to the best performances of his career.

title: Will Zverev stop Djokovic's pursuit of a 25th Grand Slam title?
description: For the second time in as many Grand Slam tournaments, Alexander Zverev will meet Novak Djokovic deep into the fortnight â€” this time in the Roland Garros quarter-finals. After a close first-set tie-break in the Australian Open semi-finals, Djokovic sent the German through to the final by retiring with a muscle tear in his left leg. There are no injury concerns to speak of at Roland Garros, where Djokovic has cruised to the quarters without losing a set and Zverev has dropped just one. Djokovic leads the pair's Lexus ATP Head2Head series 8-5, a record that includes a 1-1 split on clay. But they have not met on the surface since the 2019 Roland Garros semi-finals, when the Serbian won in straight sets. "He was much better than me back then, I would say, especially at the Grand Slam level," recalled Zverev, who is now three spots above Djokovic in the PIF ATP Rankings at World No. 3. "We played a lot of matches since then. We played at Grand Slams since then. We have had a lot of tough battles. I have had a lot of great wins against him. I have had a lot of tough losses against him. We have great history in our rivalry, I would say, but I'm looking forward to the match, and it's always a privilege to be on court with him." Both players have excelled on all surfaces throughout their careers, with clay not a particular strength or weakness for either. Zverev, whose game is built on his booming serve and his rock-solid backhand, figures to have the advantage in the longer rallies thanks to his youth. "He's 10 years younger. He calls himself a veteran of the game. What should I call myself, then?" Djokovic joked. But the Serbian has been dialled in with his all-around game and could succeed in moving the German around the expansive Court Philippe-Chatrier. This manâ€™s humour ðŸ˜‚ðŸ˜‚ðŸ˜‚ we love it#novakdjokovic #rolandgarros pic.twitter.com/t5IImKbDM5 â€” ATP Tour (@atptour) June 2, 2025 Roland Garros has been Zverev's most consistent Slam, with the returning finalist reaching at least the semi-finals in each of the past four years. Djokovic has won the tournament three times, most recently in 2023. The Serbian also won Olympic gold at the Paris venue last year, and enters the quarter-finals on a 21-match winning streak at the site. He withdrew ahead of last year's quarter-finals with a right-knee injury. Despite suffering four first-round defeats in five events earlier this year, Djokovic has also reached the Miami ATP Masters 1000 final and won his 100th tour-level title in Geneva. Asked if he considered the Serbian an outsider in the Paris title hunt, Zverev was quick to set the record straight. "Novak Djokovic will never be a [dark] horse," he said of the 24-time major champ. "For me, Carlos is the favourite. I have said that before. Then I would say the next three in line are Jannik [Sinner], myself, and Novak, right? I still believe that. I still believe on tennis and on experience Novak is up there with us, no question about that at all." Zverev's path to the title could go through all three of those elite opponents. While Alcaraz is on the other side of the draw, Sinner could await in the semi-finals if the Italian beats surprise package Alexander Bublik. Sinner has been scintillating in his progress this fortnight, earning four dominant wins as he seeks his third consecutive Grand Slam crown. But the mercurial Bublik will have nothing to lose in his first Grand Slam quarter-final. The Kazakhstani has already knocked off two Top 10 players in Paris: Alex de Minaur and Jack Draper. His power and unpredictability could make for an uncomfortable outing for Sinner, who is bidding for his first Roland Garros title and his first major trophy outside of his favoured hard courts. Sinner leads the pair's Lexus ATP Head2Head series 3-1, but this will be their first clash on clay. They have played twice on grass and twice on hard. [NEWSLETTER FORM]

title: What is the Roland Garros tennis schedule?
description: Roland Garros continues on Wednesday in Paris, where quarter-final action concludes. Novak Djokovic faces Alexander Zverev in a blockbuster clash and World No. 1 Jannik Sinner takes on Alexander Bublik. View the full order of play for WednesdayÂ here and see featured matches below. title: French Open 2025 Day Ten Recap
description: Day Ten at Roland Garros saw the first two menâ€™s semi-final spots claimed, and neither match went the distance. Lorenzo Musetti continued his dream clay season with a composed four-set win over Frances Tiafoe, seizing the key moments late in the third before powering through the fourth to reach his first Grand Slam semi-final. Carlos â€¦
author: Jonathan

title: French Open 2025 Day Nine Recap
description: The second week of Roland Garros began with the top seeds firmly in control. Jannik Sinner dismantled Andrey Rublev in straight sets to cruise into the quarter-finals, while Novak Djokovic marked yet another milestone, his 100th win at the French Open, with a clinical performance over Cameron Norrie. Alexander Zverev progressed after a premature retirement â€¦
author: Jonathan
